timeline.message:
Add performance test for token transfer publish only

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Add initial REST query part of HTS Performance test

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Add new performance test for HTS e2e and adjust existing test

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Refactor Token Transfer Publish and Retrieve test

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Refactor HTS Batch Publish Batch Retrieve test

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

replies.bodyText: License info should now be on all new classes thus far, I'll keep it in mind to add it as I refactor some of these into smaller classes.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: All comments should be up to date now, I looked for anything mentioning messages, topics, or hcs and changed them accordingly
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I've made this change, however do you want me to update/add the property it pulls from as well?  I tried to reuse the existing hcs publisher properties so that the .properties file doesn't grow out of control, I'm starting to wonder if putting a new .hts.* set of properties would be better because they're going to be entangled otherwise.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText:
Let's reuse. I saw you made it transactionsPerBatchCount which makes sense.
If we ever get into a case where we want to publish multiple transaction types at different rates then we can add that property or think of an easier way to do it.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.author: Nana-EC
Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I've kept the code the same here as it later can use the TransactionId object to do validation with the receipt, but I have turned this logic into a method later on down the line, thanks.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText:
I made a suggestion in submitTokenTransfer
Assuming it doesn't impact the submission performance that's one way.
Another way would be to do the same over here instead
formattedTransactionIds.add(transactionId.accountId.toString() + "-" + transactionId.validStart
                .getEpochSecond() + "-" + transactionId.validStart.getNano());
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Good call, I've turned this into a method and moved it into a new Utility class, if it would be better suited elsewhere let me know.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
This seems generic and could be applied to other existing and future entities.
Should we rename it more generically?
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I ended up breaking this down even farther, I made a REST Request and then a REST getByIds Request extending that, a Publish Request and a TokenTransferPublishRequest extending that, and finally a composite class of those two to be used for the GetAndRetrieve test.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: You should have TokenTransferRequest inherit from the generic class noted above.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
I used similar logic in my acceptance tests and Steven had noted better to use the  UriBuilder feature in WebClient.
If not too much overhead, could be applicable here also
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Cool, didn't know about that, I've made this change
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: See method suggestion of TransactionId to compliant rest transaction Id noted earlier
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Made the necessary change as noted above.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Here and in other places comments still refer to topic instead of tokens
timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Should we consider moving this to a shared class, so all *PublishSampler classes can utilize it and other shared sampler logic?
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: That seems like a good move, I've created a PublishSampler that has that method and allows for a custom message at the front and the three Publish samplers are extending it now
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Don't use DescriptiveStatistics as it keeps all values in memory and has resulted in memory leaks in the past. Use SummaryStatistics instead even though we miss out on percentiles. Can you change everywhere else using  DescriptiveStatistics including existing classes?
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Sure, the only other place was the HCS Topic Message Publisher, all instances should now be converted to Summary.
replies.author: ijungmann
